Daniels' new attorney, Michael Avenatti, has been a fixture on TV. Daniels herself is scheduled to be interviewed on 60 Minutes on March 25. But another woman, former Playboy Playmate Karen McDougal, whose story has attracted significantly less attention, may end up being a bigger problem for Trump. (McDougal will appear on TV this Thursday on CNN with Anderson Cooper.) In some respects, McDougal's story is similar to Daniels'. Like Daniels, she met Trump at a 2006 golf tournament in Lake Tahoe. Trump later wined and dined both women at the Beverly Hills Hotel.

The Huskies had a rough go early in the season, and LaMelo mocked the team's struggles in a November tweet, calling them the worst. The Huskies would have the last laugh, though. context_meta.summary: Sandy Blampied knew something was seriously wrong when she returned to an empty Long Island home that day in October 1966 — instead of her mother's open arms. “I went to school, to seventh grade, and when I came home from school, she was gone. She would never leave me alone.” For more than 50 years, the disappearance of 38-year-old Louise Pietrewicz has been an unsolved mystery in Suffolk County, where she vanished without a trace other than a pocketbook found days later on the side of Route 25. context_meta.title: This woman faked an entire trip to Disneyland on Instagram to prove a crucial point about social media
context_meta.summary: But one blogger and Instagram star just used social media to fake out her hundreds of thousands of followers — including her IRL friends and family. She successfully faked a trip to Disneyland, proving just how deceptive social media can be, and how we shouldn't view it as a true measure of reality. Carolyn Stritch is a 32-year-old photographer, blogger, and Instagram influencer from the U.K., and she often shares picture-perfect shots and behind-the-scenes stories from her adventures on her lifestyle blog, The Slow Traveler. But for her latest journey, Stritch set out to encourage her followers to “question everything” when it comes to the aspirational images they see on their feeds each day.
